Params: {1: 'This is a story that happened between moments of the past.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 7: '1', 10: '1'}
{1: 'It was the night before a girl set out on a <phonetic=hardship>journey</phonetic> to face her fate.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 7: '1', 10: '1'}
{1: 'And it was the last moment of warmth she would ever know.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 7: '2', 10: '1'}
{3: 'The pink-haired woman stands silently, watching the destruction from above.'}
{3: 'An alert beeps, and she looks at the device on her wrist.'}
{3: 'After a brief pondering, she decides to investigate.'}
{3: 'It is like coming out of the darkness of first birth to see a broken world.'}
{3: 'Ruined buildings are everywhere. The ground shakes and the light changes constantly.'}
{3: 'Despite the chaos, you feel oddly calm.'}
{3: 'Even basic thoughts hurt. All you can picture are these red "lines".'}
{3: 'The red lines tremble, sending out deep, cosmic tones.'}
{3: "The sounds from space's overture signal the end of time."}
{3: 'A figure seems to appear near the red lines, quietly arranging them.'}
{3: 'A loud noise jolts you back to reality.'}
{3: 'Pieces of the ruins fall around you, a clear sign that this place is not safe anymore.'}
{3: 'You look toward where the voice comes from and see a pink-haired woman running toward you, waving frantically.'}
{3: 'You try to run after her, but you fall after just a couple of steps.'}
{3: 'It is not that you are weak. More accurately, your mind has not acclimatized to this body.'}
{3: 'Like a terminal overloaded with programs, your body is slow to react.'}
{3: 'When she sees you fall, the pink-haired woman instantly grabs your hand.'}
{3: 'She pulls you along, guiding your sluggish body as you run around the corner.'}
{3: 'A golden, glowing gate stands before you.'}
{3: 'You go through the gate, and everything changes.'}
{3: 'You are standing on a rooftop, and in the distance—'}
{3: 'Meteors rain down, ripping through the sky and leaving fiery trails.'}
{3: 'The star, meant to warm the planet, flickers and dies out.'}
{3: 'As it flutters, the whole cosmos turns crimson, the red tint creeping across the night sky and radiating pure doom.'}
{3: 'And the earth—the ground itself—is torn apart by strange gravity, rising and crashing down.'}
{3: 'Magnetic fields become visible, pulling tons of magnetic materials into a vortex to form a massive, writhing snake on the ground.'}
{3: 'A gust of wind sweeps her hair aside, showing sorrowful eyes. She stares ahead as if she is burning the scene into her memory forever.'}
{3: 'It only lasts a second, but it feels like forever before she finally looks away and turns to you.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'I picked up parameter fluctuations in spacetime and found you here. No one should have been here.', 18: '100006406'}
{3: 'The anomaly in the distance is getting closer, and it is clear you are both going to be wiped out soon.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "You don't know? How did you even get here?", 18: '100006408'}
{3: 'Ishmael lowers her head in deep thought.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Could this be a side effect of time travel? I've never heard of anything like this before.", 18: '100006409'}
{3: 'The wind picks up as Ishmael looks up at you.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'Do you still have the time travel terminal on you?', 18: '100006410'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'The Temporal Plane Disruption and Spatial Positioning Restoration Terminal.', 18: '100006411'}
{2: "I don't understand any of that.", 3: '244', 4: "I'm sure I don't have anything like that.", 5: '244'}
{3: 'Hearing that, Ishmael thinks for a second before holding out her hand.'}
{3: 'She checks the device on her wrist, confirms the parameters settings, and then looks back.'}
{3: 'The device shines a deep blue light, enveloping Ishmael like liquid before flowing along your hands and covering you too.'}
{3: 'In the final moment, the stars before your eyes fade to gray, and in the next second, everything plunges into darkness.'}
{3: 'You hit the ground hard. Everything looks blurry, and you feel dizzy.'}
{3: 'Still, you can about make out you are in some kind of research facility with your hazy vision.'}
{1: '1', 2: '??', 3: 'Why have you cut the mission short, and why have you brought someone back?', 4: '1', 18: '100006414'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Did you bring the medicine? I didn't have a spare terminal when we came back.", 4: '2', 18: '100006415'}
{3: 'Something has been attached to the back of your hand.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "It's an adaptation agent. It'll help with your symptoms. Don't worry.", 4: '2', 18: '100006419'}
{3: 'You feel a capsule go into your mouth, and it dissolves right away.'}
{3: 'After taking the agent, your vision clears, and the dizziness goes away.'}
{3: 'You are finally able to stand up and look around properly.'}
{3: 'You are clearly in a research facility. Behind you is an open area with all sorts of mechanical arms.'}
{3: "The open space's floor is a little bit different from its surroundings—it is a hexagonal platform made of glass-like material that emits a soft white glow."}
{3: 'Nearby, a few staff members hunch over their workstations, jotting data down and acting indifferent. They do not seem to care what is going on.'}
{3: 'You can see more of those hexagonal platforms in the distance, each with workstations nearby.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'Every time you travel through time and space, reality changes a bit.', 4: '1', 18: '100006420'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "They're recording how reality has changed—it's incredibly important and takes a lot of focus.", 4: '1', 18: '100006421'}
{3: 'The woman cuts Ishmael off, her voice sounding urgent.'}
{1: '1', 2: '??', 3: "Why did you bring someone else back? You know that's against protocol.", 4: '2', 18: '100006422'}
{2: '??', 3: 'And you arrived from the Terminus Year, of all times.', 4: '2', 18: '100006423'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'This person was at the target location and was likely a time traveler as well.', 4: '1', 18: '100006424'}
{3: "The woman's face does not change upon Ishmael's explanation."}
{3: 'Ishmael starts introducing everyone after her brief explanation.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'This is Ta·3T-class, who helped build this place and manages missions for some time travelers.', 4: '1', 18: '100006425'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'While on my mission, I detected time-space fluctuations and decided to check them out...', 4: '1', 18: '100006427'}
{3: 'While Ishmael explains, Ta·3T-class scans you both with a strange device.'}
{3: 'After seeing the scans are normal, Ta·3T-class looks a bit relieved.'}
{3: 'After Ishmael finishes explaining, Ta·3T-class shakes her head with resignation.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ta·3T-class', 3: 'Using a time travel terminal for two people is really dangerous.', 4: '1', 18: '100006428'}
{2: 'Ta·3T-class', 3: "It's not worth risking it for a stranger.", 4: '1', 18: '100006429'}
{3: 'She pauses and lets out a sigh.'}
{2: 'Ta·3T-class', 3: 'Putting yourself in danger for someone you just met...', 4: '1', 18: '100006431'}
{2: 'Ta·3T-class', 3: "I've heard how compassionate you are, but this is way beyond what I expected.", 4: '1', 18: '100006432'}
{3: 'Ta·3T-class turns from Ishmael, who is trying to avoid her reprimand, and faces you.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ta·3T-class', 3: "Since you got there through time travel, you must be a time traveler as well. I'll check our database—we might have your details on file.", 4: '1', 18: '100006435'}
{2: 'Ta·3T-class', 3: "Even though you got here in an unexpected way, and I can't say exactly who you are, but...", 4: '1', 18: '100006436'}
{2: 'Ta·3T-class', 3: "Obviously. We're the organization that deals with time travel.", 4: '1', 18: '100006438'}
{2: 'Ta·3T-class', 3: 'Ishmael will show you around. You can stay here for now.', 4: '1', 18: '100006439'}
{3: 'She finishes speaking and turns back to Ishmael.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ta·3T-class', 3: "I've got other things to handle. Mael, will you look after...", 4: '1', 18: '100006440'}
{3: "She pauses, realizing she hasn't asked the stranger's name."}
{2: "(You shrug, indicating you don't remember your name either)", 3: '389'}
{3: "She pats Ishmael's shoulder and walks away with the weariness of someone facing another overtime shift."}
{1: '1', 3: 'Once Ta·3T-class is gone, Ishmael turns to you.'}
{2: 'Including my name.', 3: '401', 4: "I can't recall it at all.", 5: '401'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'How about I give you a code name? We can use that until you remember your name.', 4: '1', 18: '100006444'}
{3: 'Ishmael puts her head down, thinking hard and muttering to herself.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'Sweet Potato... No, no... Kukuro... or maybe Cthu...', 4: '1', 18: '100006446'}
{3: 'She claps her hands, done with her brainstorming.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'The nebula was gray when I brought you here, so how about "Gray Raven"?', 4: '1', 18: '100006448'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "It's said the Four-Winged White Raven brings good fortune.", 4: '1', 18: '100006449'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Something stirs inside you like a ripple, but then it is gone.'}
{2: 'No... It just feels kind of familiar.', 3: '438'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "It's okay. Take your time. You'll remember.", 4: '1', 18: '100006453'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Come on, let's go to the break room first.", 4: '1', 18: '100006454'}
{3: 'As you head toward the exit, you ask Ishmael about the research institute.'}
{2: 'Oh, and what was that glowing gate we went through?', 3: '447'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: "That's a phase transmission screen, more commonly known as a portal. You don't remember those?", 4: '1', 18: '100006455'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Teleportation's pretty standard. It's common knowledge these days.", 4: '1', 18: '100006456'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Looks like you've forgotten quite a bit.", 4: '1', 18: '100006457'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'The Temporal Plane Disruption and Spatial Positioning Restoration Terminal.', 4: '1', 18: '100006458'}
{2: 'Do we have to say the whole thing every time?', 3: '456', 4: "That's a mouthful...", 5: '456'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'We usually just call them time travel terminals or travel terminals. Take your pick.', 4: '1', 18: '100006459'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'They have to work with the time mainframe.', 4: '1', 18: '100006460'}
{3: 'Ishmael smiles, understanding what you are getting at.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "I'll skip its official name this time.", 4: '1', 18: '100006461'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'The mainframe uses a supercomputer to run everything. It holds all the terminal data.', 4: '1', 18: '100006462'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'Think of the time travel terminals as "ropes"—one end\'s tied to the mainframe, the other to the time traveler.', 4: '1', 18: '100006463'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'When a time traveler needs to get back to "Shrike", the "ropes" pull them in.', 4: '1', 18: '100006464'}
{3: 'Your vision goes blurry for a second, then goes back to normal. You see a quick flash.'}
{3: "Ishmael doesn't react, like she doesn't notice anything."}
{3: 'Could this be a side effect of time travel?'}
{3: 'Ta·3T-class walks down the corridor, calling to the supercomputer "Silence".'}
{2: 'Ta·3T-class', 3: '"Silence", get me the personnel files from "Shrike".', 4: '1', 18: '100006465'}
{3: 'Following Ishmael, you walk down a corridor to a large screen. Data is swirling around it, and a giant red number sits in the middle.'}
{3: 'Ishmael looks at where you are pointing and sees the number.'}
{3: 'She goes quiet for a moment, her voice turning solemn.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "The world's going to be destroyed soon. Shrike's trying to stop that with time travel.", 4: '1', 18: '100006469'}
{2: 'Does it have something to do with what we saw before?', 3: '505'}
{3: 'Remembering the world\'s destruction you saw earlier, you feel a pang of "pain".'}
{3: '—It feels like you have seen something like this before.'}
{3: 'A weird noise is coming from the hexagonal platform nearby.'}
{3: '...Followed by the sound of a body hitting the ground.'}
{3: 'You look over and see a bloodied time traveler on the floor.'}
{3: 'He makes a sound before coughing and spitting blood.'}
{3: 'With his last bit of strength, he forces out a desperate cry.'}
{3: 'Before anyone can react, alarms go off throughout the research institute.'}
